newsitem.title: USA: Vital Signs sees lower earnings/costs up.
newsitem.headline: Vital Signs sees lower earnings/costs up.

text.p: Vital Signs Inc said Tuesday it expects higher selling costs to adversely affect earnings as it expands the size of its overall sales organization and trains new salespersons to sell new and existing products.

Vital Signs said that, because of its previously announced acquisition of Marquest Medical Products Inc, it will divide the organization into two separate sales forces -- one focused on anesthesia and the other on respiratory/critical care.
"We believe that, over time, this sale force expansion will enhance sales and earnings' performance," said Terry Wall, chief executive officer of Vital Signs.
Vital Signs and its subsidiaries design, manufacture and market single-use medical products for anesthesia and critical care.
